channel.title: Forgot how to work with compile
channel.description:
I dont know anymore how to work with compile.bat lol :s 15 minutes ago when i get a new pc i know it lol
if im editing client.java i need to run the compile.bat at the same time? or if im editing i need to save client.java and after saving run compile.bat
:confused: [glow=red,2,300]lol im stupid i forgot lol [/glow] :confused:
btw if i edit client.java and i chance the welcomes message it doesnt edit it in the game but its still the normal source :confused: [glow=red,2,300]whats wrong [/glow] :confused:[br][size=1]Posted at: July 29, 2006, 03:04:08 PM[/size][hr]lol tell me again lol ppl waiting to go on my server again lol :eek:[br][size=1]Posted at: July 29, 2006, 03:45:20 PM[/size][hr][glow=red,2,300][center][size=40pt]Fixed! it was a problem becouse i was using a other source than the compile.bat was from[/size][/center] :p[/glow]

item.title: Forgot how to work with compile
item.dc:creator: @PussyCrunch PussyCrunch
item.description:
@PussyCrunch wrote:

Your making this a lot harder than it is. I’m confused now so I will explain it again. I reccomend you start over also. Un-install your development kit, and runtime enviroment, then download it again. Extract your Sources file again, but to your .bin file. THATS IT!! don’t take any “icons” from your JDK or JRE or else you will screw it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot how to work with compile
item.dc:creator: @PussyCrunch PussyCrunch
item.description:
@PussyCrunch wrote:

Yes, but after you do that, try compiling, and if you get Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: again, then you will have to uninstall your JDK and JRE and re-install it, then extract your source again, and do it again. And you should be set.

Read full topic

item.source: Forgot how to work with compile

item.title: Forgot how to work with compile
item.dc:creator: @PussyCrunch PussyCrunch
item.description:
@PussyCrunch wrote:

Ok, you would have to specify your paths. This is how…

Open your start menu, right-click on my computer and select properties. Next, click your advanced tab. After that, click Enviroment Varibles. Then click the New button, that is up top.

Now, where is says Varible name, put…

Classpath

And where it says Varible Value, put…

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\bin

Then click Ok

After that click New again. (The same button as before) and for Varible name put…

path

And for Varible value, put…

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\bin

NOTE: You must have all your sources files in your JDK .bin file or else you will get compile error that says “javac” isn’t recognized.

Read full topic
